info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 4:21PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Storey and south central Washoe Counties through 445 PM PDT... At 420 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Spanish Springs, or 7 miles northeast of Reno, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sparks, Lockwood, Wingfield Springs, Spanish Springs, Hidden Valley, Mustang, Patrick and Sun Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
